sub_title: Head of Digital Economy and Governance at ECDPM
summary:
Chloe Teevan (@ChloeTvan) is Head of the Digital Economy and Governance work stream at the European Centre for Development Policy Management (ECDPM). Her research interests focus on the geopolitics of EU foreign and development policy, digital regional integration in Africa and EU D4D policy. She is also a non-resident scholar with the North Africa and Sahel program at the Middle East Institute in Washington DC. 

She previously worked with the European Council on Foreign Relations (ECFR), in the non-profit sector in Cairo and as an independent research consultant. She has published with outlets including ISPI, the Oxford Institute for Energy Studies, Carnegie’s “Sada” blog, Middle East Eye, IEMed and spoken on BBC World News, AlJazeera, France 24 and others. 

Chloe holds a MA in Arab Studies from Georgetown University’s School of Foreign Service and a BA in history and political science from Trinity College Dublin.

treasury_media: [{'url': 'https://ecdpm.org/work/global-gateway-and-eu-digital-actor-africa', 'title': 'The Global Gateway and the EU as a digital actor in Africa – ECDPM', 'description': 'The EU’s approach to digital in its external action is evolving, driven by a combination of global geopolitics and an externalisation of domestic policy priorities. ECDPM’s Chloe Teevan and Ennatu Domingo explore the EU’s changing approach and argue that the Global Gateway strategy has the ingredients to help make Team Europe a geopolitical actor in the digital area.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4E27AQE2jnP43-w35w/articleshare-shrink_1280_800/0/1691928703789?e=1692943200&v=beta&t=MHBt4Gg2JK4JzP7-OjW9tJkviX-b9R6Klsv3QccmjLc'}, {'url': 'https://www.routledge.com/AfricaEurope-Cooperation-and-Digital-Transformation/Daniels-Erforth-Teevan/p/book/9781032228235', 'title': 'Book: Africa–Europe Cooperation and Digital Transformation', 'description': 'Africa–Europe Cooperation and Digital Transformation explores the opportunities and challenges for cooperation between Africa and Europe in the digital sphere. The authors shed light on issues ranging from economic growth, youth employment, and gender, to regulatory frameworks, business environments, entrepreneurship, and interest-driven power politics.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4D27AQFpT65-11CU-Q/articleshare-shrink_800/0/1691592222548?e=1692943200&v=beta&t=4MaKcxVNTC17YFrcGgHdnnv4cdCgBRKyQL9wmSQU7Q8'}, {'url': 'https://ecdpm.org/work/digital-geopolitics-africa-moving-strategy-action', 'title': 'Digital geopolitics in Africa: Moving from strategy to action (w. Lidet Tadesse)', 'description': 'Digital transformation in Africa will create immense social, economic and political opportunities, but without adequate regulation, it also carries risks. Chloe Teevan and Lidet Tadesse Shiferaw argue that for Africa to avoid becoming a pawn of digital geopolitics, it will have to proactively step up technological innovation and respond to challenges, while shaping the global discourse on internet and data governance.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4E27AQFAcK8rdiKSaA/articleshare-shrink_1280_800/0/1691928703612?e=1692943200&v=beta&t=1FSmwSg_MSo7dvHbqguTyxqQO8eMKIl0j0sychTAEfk'}, {'url': 'https://ecdpm.org/work/digital-diplomacy-and-eus-quest-digital-geopolitical-relevance', 'title': 'Digital diplomacy and the EU’s quest for digital geopolitical relevance', 'description': 'The EU hopes to strengthen its global role in digital affairs. This was apparent in the July 2022 Council Conclusions on digital diplomacy. Yet, building a stronger European digital footprint will require the EU institutions to develop a coherent approach between internal and external digital policy, and member states to embrace a more comprehensive approach to digital in external action.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4E27AQE8wRj4erDaIg/articleshare-shrink_1280_800/0/1691156569759?e=1692943200&v=beta&t=UIUR7V4TAElgvl4ZgLyg5sLu1EcRGffDhrJARvUHgHY'}, {'url': 'https://ecdpm.org/work/global-gateway-recipe-eu-geopolitical-relevance', 'title': 'The Global Gateway: A recipe for EU geopolitical relevance?', 'description': 'Chloe Teevan, San Bilal, Ennatu Domingo and Alfonso Medinilla argue that the Global Gateway – the EU’s new connectivity strategy – has the seeds of something new, but that it will need to overcome a number of challenges to be successful.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4E27AQF_i_q3hAr7GQ/articleshare-shrink_1280_800/0/1691156569983?e=1692943200&v=beta&t=msRfVh80mRFBrv9vRaTawzgSQnEdO_Z-LwZNWiqbMVU'}, {'url': None, 'title': 'A new multilateralism for the post-COVID world: What role for the EU-Africa partnership? - ETTG', 'description': 'EU leaders are keen to reinforce Multilateralism, but strengthening multilateral cooperation will require partners. In this paper, we argue that Africa - and especially the AU with its 55 members - could be an important partner, but cannot be taken for granted.', 'image': None}, {'url': None, 'title': 'Strengthening the digital partnership between Africa and Europe - ETTG', 'description': 'My paper with Chux Daniels (ACET and the University of Sussex), Benedikt Erforth (DIE) & Rob Floyd (ACET) on #EU-#Africa digital partnership', 'image': None}, {'url': 'https://mipa.institute/6866', 'title': 'EU-Morocco: a win-win partnership?', 'description': 'Morocco and the EU have laid out an ambitious roadmap for a “partnership of shared prosperity,” but the relationship remains technocratic and largely transactional', 'image': None}, {'url': 'https://www.ecfr.eu/article/commentary_beyond_bouteflika_algeria_protests_demand_whole_system_clear_out', 'title': 'Beyond Bouteflika: Algeria protests demand whole system “Clear out”', 'description': 'The president has resigned under pressure from the street and, now, the army. But Algeria’s protest movement will unlikely accept anything less than wholesale reform', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4D27AQET1gmIm47JTg/articleshare-shrink_1280_800/0/1691233570920?e=1692943200&v=beta&t=Zjh8g4VPh9qfMyVzCpP1CAR6p59nlm_NQSw8U6opfSQ'}, {'url': 'https://www.ecfr.eu/article/commentary_morocco_the_eu_and_the_migration_dilemma', 'title': 'Morocco, the EU, and the migration dilemma', 'description': 'Greater numbers of migrants arriving in Spain from Morocco has put both states under pressure', 'image': None}]
